00023 /**
00024  * Convenience class for I/O operations on file descriptors.
00025  *
00026  * This class provides convenience methods for:
00027  *  - sending and receiving raw data over a file descriptor.
00028  *  - sending and receiving messages over a file descriptor.
00029  *  - file descriptor passing over a Unix socket.
00030  * All of these methods use exceptions for error reporting.
00031  *
00032  * There are two kinds of messages:
00033  *  - Array messages. These are just a list of strings, and the message
00034  *    itself has a specific length. The contained strings may not
00035  *    contain NUL characters (<tt>'\\0'</tt>). Note that an array message
00036  *    must have at least one element.
00037  *  - Scalar messages. These are byte strings which may contain arbitrary
00038  *    binary data. Scalar messages also have a specific length.
00039  * The protocol is designed to be low overhead, easy to implement and
00040  * easy to parse.
00041  *
00042  * MessageChannel is to be wrapped around a file descriptor. For example:
00043  * @code
00044  *    int p[2];
00045  *    pipe(p);
00046  *    MessageChannel channel1(p[0]);
00047  *    MessageChannel channel2(p[1]);
00048  *    
00049  *    // Send an array message.
00050  *    channel2.write("hello", "world !!", NULL);
00051  *    list<string> args;
00052  *    channel1.read(args);    // args now contains { "hello", "world !!" }
00053  *
00054  *    // Send a scalar message.
00055  *    channel2.writeScalar("some long string which can contain arbitrary binary data");
00056  *    string str;
00057  *    channel1.readScalar(str);
00058  * @endcode
00059  *
00060  * The life time of a MessageChannel is independent from that of the
00061  * wrapped file descriptor. If a MessageChannel object is destroyed,
00062  * the file descriptor is not automatically closed. Call close()
00063  * if you want to close the file descriptor.
00064  *
00065  * @note I/O operations are not buffered.
00066  * @note Be careful with mixing the sending/receiving of array messages,
00067  *    scalar messages and file descriptors. If you send a collection of any
00068  *    of these in a specific order, then the receiving side must receive them
00069  *    in the exact some order. So suppose you first send a message, then a
00070  *    file descriptor, then a scalar, then the receiving side must first
00071  *    receive a message, then a file descriptor, then a scalar. If the
00072  *    receiving side does things in the wrong order then bad things will
00073  *    happen.
00074  * @note MessageChannel is thread-safe.
00075  *
00076  * @ingroup Support
00077  */
00078 class MessageChannel {
00079 private:
00080         const static char DELIMITER = '\0';
00081         int fd;

00088          * MessageChannel variable which is to be initialized later.
00089          */
00090         MessageChannel() {
00091                 this->fd = -1;
00092         }

00112         /**
00113          * Send an array message, which consists of the given elements, over the underlying
00114          * file descriptor.
00115          *
00116          * @param args The message elements.
00117          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00118          * @pre None of the message elements may contain a NUL character (<tt>'\\0'</tt>).
00119          * @see read(), write(const char *, ...)
00120          */
00121         void write(const list<string> &args) {
00122                 list<string>::const_iterator it;
00123                 string data;
00124                 uint16_t dataSize = 0;
00125 
00126                 for (it = args.begin(); it != args.end(); it++) {
00127                         dataSize += it->size() + 1;
00128                 }
00129                 data.reserve(dataSize + sizeof(dataSize));
00130                 dataSize = htons(dataSize);
00131                 data.append((const char *) &dataSize, sizeof(dataSize));
00132                 for (it = args.begin(); it != args.end(); it++) {
00133                         data.append(*it);
00134                         data.append(1, DELIMITER);
00135                 }
00136                 
00137                 writeRaw(data);
00138         }

00140         /**
00141          * Send an array message, which consists of the given strings, over the underlying
00142          * file descriptor.
00143          *
00144          * @param name The first element of the message to send.
00145          * @param ... Other elements of the message. These *must* be strings, i.e. of type char*.
00146          *            It is also required to terminate this list with a NULL.
00147          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00148          * @pre None of the message elements may contain a NUL character (<tt>'\\0'</tt>).
00149          * @see read(), write(const list<string> &)
00150          */
00151         void write(const char *name, ...) {
00152                 list<string> args;
00153                 args.push_back(name);
00154                 
00155                 va_list ap;
00156                 va_start(ap, name);
00157                 while (true) {
00158                         const char *arg = va_arg(ap, const char *);
00159                         if (arg == NULL) {
00160                                 break;
00161                         } else {
00162                                 args.push_back(arg);
00163                         }
00164                 }
00165                 va_end(ap);
00166                 write(args);
00167         }

00182          *
00183          * @param data The scalar message's content.

00187          * @see readScalar(), writeScalar(const string &)

00189         void writeScalar(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00190                 uint32_t l = htonl(size);
00191                 writeRaw((const char *) &l, sizeof(uint32_t));
00192                 writeRaw(data, size);
00193         }

00195         /**
00196          * Send a block of data over the underlying file descriptor.
00197          * This method blocks until everything is sent.
00198          *
00199          * @param data The data to send.
00200          * @param size The number of bytes in <tt>data</tt>.
00201          * @pre <tt>data != NULL</tt>
00202          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00203          * @see readRaw()
00204          */
00205         void writeRaw(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00206                 ssize_t ret;
00207                 unsigned int written = 0;
00208                 do {
00209                         do {
00210                                 ret = ::write(fd, data + written, size - written);
00211                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00212                         if (ret == -1) {
00213                                 throw SystemException("write() failed", errno);
00214                         } else {
00215                                 written += ret;
00216                         }
00217                 } while (written < size);
00218         }

00226          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.

00228         void writeRaw(const string &data) {
00229                 writeRaw(data.c_str(), data.size());

00232         /**
00233          * Pass a file descriptor. This only works if the underlying file
00234          * descriptor is a Unix socket.
00235          *
00236          * @param fileDescriptor The file descriptor to pass.
00237          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during file descriptor passing.
00238          * @pre <tt>fileDescriptor >= 0</tt>
00239          * @see readFileDescriptor()
00240          */
00241         void writeFileDescriptor(int fileDescriptor) {
00242                 struct msghdr msg;
00243                 struct iovec vec[1];
00244                 char buf[1];
00245                 struct {
00246                         struct cmsghdr hdr;
00247                         int fd;
00248                 } cmsg;
00249         
00250                 msg.msg_name = NULL;
00251                 msg.msg_namelen = 0;
00252         
00253                 /* Linux and Solaris doesn't work if msg_iov is NULL. */
00254                 buf[0] = '\0';
00255                 vec[0].iov_base = buf;
00256                 vec[0].iov_len = 1;
00257                 msg.msg_iov = vec;
00258                 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
00259         
00260                 msg.msg_control = (caddr_t)&cmsg;
00261                 msg.msg_controllen = CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int));
00262                 msg.msg_flags = 0;
00263                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len = CMSG_LEN(sizeof(int));
00264                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level = SOL_SOCKET;
00265                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type = SCM_RIGHTS;
00266                 cmsg.fd = fileDescriptor;
00267                 
00268                 if (sendmsg(fd, &msg, 0) == -1) {
00269                         throw SystemException("Cannot send file descriptor with sendmsg()", errno);
00270                 }
00271         }

00273         /**
00274          * Receive a message from the underlying file descriptor.
00275          *
00276          * @param args The message will be put in this variable.
00277          * @return Whether end-of-file has been reached. If so, then the contents
00278          *         of <tt>args</tt> will be undefined.
00279          * @throws SystemException If an error occured while receiving the message.
00280          * @see write()
00281          */
00282         bool read(vector<string> &args) {
00283                 uint16_t size;
00284                 int ret;
00285                 unsigned int alreadyRead = 0;
00286                 
00287                 do {
00288                         do {
00289                                 ret = ::read(fd, (char *) &size + alreadyRead, sizeof(size) - alreadyRead);
00290                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00291                         if (ret == -1) {
00292                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00293                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00294                                 return false;
00295                         }
00296                         alreadyRead += ret;
00297                 } while (alreadyRead < sizeof(size));
00298                 size = ntohs(size);
00299                 
00300                 string buffer;
00301                 args.clear();
00302                 buffer.reserve(size);
00303                 while (buffer.size() < size) {
00304                         char tmp[1024 * 8];
00305                         do {
00306                                 ret = ::read(fd, tmp, min(size - buffer.size(), sizeof(tmp)));
00307                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00308                         if (ret == -1) {
00309                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00310                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00311                                 return false;
00312                         }
00313                         buffer.append(tmp, ret);
00314                 }
00315                 
00316                 if (!buffer.empty()) {
00317                         string::size_type start = 0, pos;
00318                         const string &const_buffer(buffer);
00319                         while ((pos = const_buffer.find('\0', start)) != string::npos) {
00320                                 args.push_back(const_buffer.substr(start, pos - start));
00321                                 start = pos + 1;
00322                         }
00323                 }
00324                 return true;
00325         }

00327         /**
00328          * Read a scalar message from the underlying file descriptor.
00329          *
00330          * @param output The message will be put in here.
00331          * @returns Whether end-of-file was reached during reading.
00332          * @throws SystemException An error occured while writing the data to the file descriptor.
00333          * @see writeScalar()
00334          */
00335         bool readScalar(string &output) {
00336                 uint32_t size;
00337                 unsigned int remaining;
00338                 
00339                 if (!readRaw(&size, sizeof(uint32_t))) {
00340                         return false;
00341                 }
00342                 size = ntohl(size);
00343                 
00344                 output.clear();
00345                 output.reserve(size);
00346                 remaining = size;
00347                 while (remaining > 0) {
00348                         char buf[1024 * 32];
00349                         unsigned int blockSize = min((unsigned int) sizeof(buf), remaining);
00350                         
00351                         if (!readRaw(buf, blockSize)) {
00352                                 return false;
00353                         }
00354                         output.append(buf, blockSize);
00355                         remaining -= blockSize;
00356                 }
00357                 return true;
00358         }

00360         /**
00361          * Read exactly <tt>size</tt> bytes of data from the underlying file descriptor,
00362          * and put the result in <tt>buf</tt>. If end-of-file has been reached, or if
00363          * end-of-file was encountered before <tt>size</tt> bytes have been read, then
00364          * <tt>false</tt> will be returned. Otherwise (i.e. if the read was successful),
00365          * <tt>true</tt> will be returned.
00366          *
00367          * @param buf The buffer to place the read data in. This buffer must be at least
00368          *            <tt>size</tt> bytes long.
00369          * @param size The number of bytes to read.
00370          * @return Whether reading was successful or whether EOF was reached.
00371          * @pre buf != NULL
00372          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong during reading.
00373          * @see writeRaw()
00374          */
00375         bool readRaw(void *buf, unsigned int size) {
00376                 ssize_t ret;
00377                 unsigned int alreadyRead = 0;
00378                 
00379                 while (alreadyRead < size) {
00380                         do {
00381                                 ret = ::read(fd, (char *) buf + alreadyRead, size - alreadyRead);
00382                         } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00383                         if (ret == -1) {
00384                                 throw SystemException("read() failed", errno);
00385                         } else if (ret == 0) {
00386                                 return false;
00387                         } else {
00388                                 alreadyRead += ret;
00389                         }
00390                 }
00391                 return true;
00392         }

00394         /**
00395          * Receive a file descriptor, which had been passed over the underlying
00396          * file descriptor.
00397          *
00398          * @return The passed file descriptor.
00399          * @throws SystemException If something went wrong during the
00400          *            receiving of a file descriptor. Perhaps the underlying
00401          *            file descriptor isn't a Unix socket.
00402          * @throws IOException Whatever was received doesn't seem to be a
00403          *            file descriptor.
00404          */
00405         int readFileDescriptor() {
00406                 struct msghdr msg;
00407                 struct iovec vec[2];
00408                 char buf[1];
00409                 struct {
00410                         struct cmsghdr hdr;
00411                         int fd;
00412                 } cmsg;
00413 
00414                 msg.msg_name = NULL;
00415                 msg.msg_namelen = 0;
00416         
00417                 vec[0].iov_base = buf;
00418                 vec[0].iov_len = sizeof(buf);
00419                 msg.msg_iov = vec;
00420                 msg.msg_iovlen = 1;
00421 
00422                 msg.msg_control = (caddr_t)&cmsg;
00423                 msg.msg_controllen = CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int));
00424                 msg.msg_flags = 0;
00425                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len = CMSG_LEN(sizeof(int));
00426                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level = SOL_SOCKET;
00427                 cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type = SCM_RIGHTS;
00428                 cmsg.fd = -1;
00429 
00430                 if (recvmsg(fd, &msg, 0) == -1) {
00431                         throw SystemException("Cannot read file descriptor with recvmsg()", errno);
00432                 }
00433 
00434                 if (msg.msg_controllen != CMSG_SPACE(sizeof(int))
00435                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_len != CMSG_SPACE(0) + sizeof(int)
00436                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_level != SOL_SOCKET
00437                  || cmsg.hdr.cmsg_type != SCM_RIGHTS) {
00438                         throw IOException("No valid file descriptor received.");
00439                 }
00440                 return cmsg.fd;
00441         }
